comments:
0508 build, clean workspace.
began opening every view in alphabetical order. 
Display view failed to fully open (title bar with gray window appears, nothing 
else). 
tried briefly to resize/close Display view to no avail.
closed eclipse.
receive error on close that workspace had trouble saving.
eclipse will no longer start (after attempting to launch, process immediately 
terminates without any ui at all).

i have the workspace if you want it. it is 12MB; i've been unsuccessful at 
attaching it to this bug report thus far.

Chris,
You appear to have a build/workspace that has compilation errors in it.
!MESSAGE Unresolved compilation problem: 
	The method setProgressMonitor
(org.eclipse.core.runtime.NullProgressMonitor) is undefined for the type 
org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.MonoReconciler

As far as I know this is not a general problem in 20020508 as I cannot 
reproduce. Which perpsective are you opening the Display view within?
Have you updated any of the plugins (like org.eclipse.ui)?

here are the exact steps to reproduce the problem from a fresh 20020508 build
(no workspace)

invoke eclipse -data c:\workspace -dev bin
file-import-external plugins and fragments-choose plugins from the runtime 
platform
select org.eclipse.ui.win32
select org.eclipse.ui
click add required plugins
deselect org.eclipse.ui.win32
deselect org.eclipse.ui
click finish
window-show view-other
expand cvs, cvs repositories
right click on cvs repositories window
new|anonymous to dev.eclipse.org
click finish
expand pserver, expand head
select org.eclipse.ui.win32
right click, check out as project
select org.eclipse.ui
right click, check out as project

repeat:
  window|show view|other
  expanding category and selecting:
    ant|ant console, etc, ..

for every view in order up to and past display view. i went as far as junit, 
including opening views that were already open as part of resource perspective
(i don't expect that had any net effect on this problem, but i wanted 
to ensure i reproduced this first time out)

i stacked all new views that opened up on to the task view. 

i'm not sure what the display view is supposed to look like in this state, but 
it was only a title bar in a solid gray panel (no text, except for 'Display').
provided that is correct, i noticed no errors at this point. 

i closed down eclipse at this point and got a 'workspace save' error dialog.

i try to restart eclipse and i get the splash screen for about 20 seconds, then 
the process terminates without any other warning.

Could not reproduce in 20020514. This could have been related to a multi-
threaded plug-in loading problem we were having. (bug# 15372). Marking 
as "works for me".

traces.message: Unresolved compilation problem:   The method setProgressMonitor (org.eclipse.core.runtime.NullProgressMonitor) is undefined for the type  org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.MonoReconciler
